title: Public Transport for the Selective Entry High Schools 2022 Year 9 Entrance Examination: Saturday 13 November and Sunday 14 November 2021
articleContent:
We're helping students get to and from the Selective Entry High Schools 2022 Year 9 Entrance Examination with extra trains on Saturday 13 November and Sunday 14 November 2021.

Before you travel

We strongly encourage you to register your myki so that we can contact you if you have been exposed to coronavirus (COVID-19) on a public transport service. Register your myki now - it's quick and easy.

When travelling on public transport you must wear a fitted face mask covering your nose and mouth, unless you have a lawful reason for not doing so, and ensure you wear it for your entire journey.

We’ve rolled QR Codes in more than 440 key locations across the public transport network, including tram stops in the Free Tram Zone, Metro and V/Line stations and key replacement bus stops. Please check-in when you see a sign.

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

 Metropolitan train

Getting to the Showgrounds

Train services will operate from Southern Cross Station (Platform 8) to Showgrounds stopping at North Melbourne (Platform 2) and express to Showgrounds Station (Platform 1).

Trains depart from Southern Cross Station:

  • 7.30am until 6.30pm, approximately every 20 minutes

Leaving the Showgrounds

Train services will operate from Showgrounds Station (Platform 1) to Southern Cross Station (Platform 8), stopping at North Melbourne (Platform 1).

Trains to depart from Showgrounds Station:

  • until 6.30pm, approximately every 20 minutes

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from the Showgrounds

Passengers can catch a Route 57 tram, alighting at Stop 32 Sandown Road/Epsom Road.

Plan your journey using Journey planner.
